data.title: Results for: All Categories
data.meta_description: William S. Burroughs was an American short story writer, essayist, painter, spoken word performer, and novelist. He was a prominent postmodernist author and wrote 18 novels and
data.text:

Burroughs, William.

Price: $3,000

Paris: The Traveller's Companion Series published by the Olympia Press, [1959]. First edition, with first issue point of green border on title page, but with "Francs: 1500" crossed out and "New Price NF 18" added on back cover. Read More Item Details for The Naked Lunch Add to Wish List

Item 319855Minutes to Go.

[Burroughs, William S.].

Price: $1,000

[Paris]: Two Cities Editions, [1960]. First edition, one of 1000 copies. The Cut-Up Technique. Poetry and cut-ups by William S. Burroughs, Brion Gysin, Sinclair Beiles, and Gregory Corso. A landmark of late twentieth century literary innovation. Burroughs' third book, inscribed by him on the title page, “For Bob Wilson, William..... Item 346756Autograph Letter, signed (“William Burroughs”), to his editor Dick Seaver.

Burroughs, William S.

Price: $2,000

London: 1966. The Remittance Man. Novelist and sometime expatriate William Burroughs writes his editor Dick Seaver from Earls Court concerning his travel plans and money matters (transcribed in full): July 25 1966 Hotel Rushmore 11 Trebovir Road London S.W. 5 Dear Dick Seaver, Received money for June thank you.
